en: Either you or your brother is wrong.
zh: 要么是你错了，要么是你弟弟错了。

en: I know you are rich.
zh: 我知道你很有钱。

en: You can't be hungry. You've just had dinner.
zh: 你不可能饿。你刚吃过晚饭。

en: I hope you'll never turn Communist.
zh: 我希望你永远不要变成共产主义者。

en: What a lonely world it will be with you away!
zh: 你不在的话，这个世界会多么寂寞啊！

en: Be sure to put out the fire before you leave.
zh: 走之前一定要把火熄灭。

en: I will not allow you to be ill-treated.
zh: 我不会允许你被虐待。

en: He will be studying when you get up.
zh: 你起床的时候，他会在学习。

en: She'll have left before you come back.
zh: 你回来之前她就已经离开了。

en: I wish you could drop in at my house on your way home.
zh: 我希望你能在回家路上顺便来我家坐坐。

en: I'll stay here till you get back.
zh: 我会待在这里直到你回来。

en: I will have finished the work before you return.
zh: 在你回来之前，我会完成这项工作。

en: The money you give them will be put to good use.
zh: 你给他们的钱会被好好利用的。

en: Thanks to your stupidity, we lost the game.
zh: 多亏了你的愚蠢，我们输了比赛。

en: It's clear that you're wrong.
zh: 很明显你错了。

en: I do not for a moment think you are wrong.
zh: 我一点也不认为你错了。

en: I can't help but think you're making a mistake.
zh: 我不禁认为你正在犯一个错误。

en: If you are wrong, I am wrong too.
zh: 如果你错了，我也错了。

en: You shouldn't have paid the bill.
zh: 你不应该付账的。

en: It is important for you to learn a foreign language.
zh: 学习一门外语对你来说很重要。

en: I'll open the curtain for you to look out.
zh: 我会为你拉开窗帘，让你向外看。

en: I'm counting on you to join us.
zh: 我指望你加入我们。

en: I am counting on you to join us.
zh: 我指望你加入我们。

en: It is a pity that you cannot travel with us.
zh: 很遗憾你不能和我们一起旅行。

en: Hearing you sing, people might take you for a girl.
zh: 听你唱歌，人们可能会把你当成女孩。

en: I'll come again when you are free.
zh: 等你空闲的时候，我会再来的。

en: It's no use your saying anything.
zh: 你说什么都没用。

en: Whatever you may say, you won't be believed.
zh: 无论你说什么，你都不会被相信。

en: Say what you will, he won't accept your invitation.
zh: 随你怎么说，他都不会接受你的邀请。

en: I haven't the faintest idea what you mean.
zh: 我完全不知道你在说什么。

en: It matters little what you do.
zh: 你做什么都无关紧要。

en: I do not mind what you do.
zh: 我不介意你做什么。

en: Whatever you say, I'll marry her.
zh: 无论你说什么，我都要娶她。

en: Say what you will, I will act on my own judgement.
zh: 随你怎么说，我会按自己的判断行事。

en: No matter what you say, he still won't do it.
zh: 无论你怎么说，他还是不会做的。

en: Whatever you may say, I don't believe you.
zh: 无论你怎么说，我都不相信你。

en: It's good to talk things over before you buy something.
zh: 买东西之前好好商量一下是好事。

en: I wish you were close to me.
zh: 我希望你能在离我近的地方。

en: It was bad of you to get angry at your wife.
zh: 你不该对你妻子发脾气。

en: Your refusal to help complicated matters.
zh: 你不肯帮忙使事情变得复杂了。

en: I can no more speak French than you can speak English.
zh: 我不会说法语，就像你不会说英语一样。

en: What is the main purpose of your studying English?
zh: 你学习英语的主要目的是什么？

en: If you could only speak English, you would be perfect.
zh: 如果你能说英语就好了，你就完美了。

en: It's evident that you told a lie.
zh: 很明显，你说了谎。

en: What is that thing in your right hand?
zh: 你右手拿着的是什么东西？

en: Would you mind making an extra cup of coffee whenever you decide to have some?
zh: 如果你要喝咖啡，能不能顺便帮我多做一杯？

en: It seems as if you are the first one here.
zh: 好像你是第一个到的。

en: It is risky for you to go into that area alone.
zh: 你独自去那个地区是很危险的。

en: I enjoyed the holiday all the better for being with you.
zh: 因为和你在一起，我更喜欢这个假期。

en: As long as you stick to one style, you can't hit upon a wonderful idea.
zh: 只要你坚持一种风格，你就不会产生绝妙的想法。

en: You are to blame.
zh: 你该受责备。

en: You are not to blame, nor is he.
zh: 你不该受责备，他也不该。

en: It is plain that you are to blame.
zh: 很明显你该受责备。

en: You need not take the trouble to go there.
zh: 你不必费心去那里。

en: You're going to leave for London next Sunday, aren't you?
zh: 你下周日就要去伦敦了，是吧？

en: It is because you are lazy that you cannot write your report.
zh: 你写不出报告就是因为你懒。

en: I will come on Monday unless you write to the contrary.
zh: 除非你来信反对，否则我周一会来。

en: I was about to leave when you telephoned.
zh: 你打电话来的时候我正要离开。

en: I'm looking forward to hearing from you.
zh: 我期待收到你的来信。

en: You go first.
zh: 你先走。

en: I heard it from you.
zh: 我是从你那里听说的。

en: I stayed home last night to be able to receive your call.
zh: 我昨晚待在家里是为了能接到你的电话。

en: I didn't expect such a nice present from you.
zh: 我没想到你会送我这么好的礼物。

en: You can do whatever you want to.
zh: 你想做什么都可以。

en: It was silly of you to trust them.
zh: 你信任他们真是太傻了。

en: I would do it in a different way than you did.
zh: 我会用和你不同的方式来做。

en: What you've done is profitable only to the enemy.
zh: 你所做的事情只会让敌人得利。

en: In terms of the pay you will get, is this a good job?
zh: 就你将获得的报酬而言，这是一份好工作吗？

en: If you were to fall from that bridge, it would be almost impossible to rescue you.
zh: 如果你从那座桥上掉下去，几乎不可能救你。

en: If you ask him again, he may change his mind.
zh: 如果你再问他一次，他可能会改变主意。

en: No harm will come to you.
zh: 你不会受到伤害。

en: I think it's wonderful that you're going on a picnic.
zh: 我觉得你要去野餐真是太棒了。

en: Is it true that you are going to Paris?
zh: 你要去巴黎是真的吗？

en: I am not any more foolish than you are.
zh: 我并不比你傻。

en: The shoes you are wearing look rather expensive.
zh: 你穿的鞋子看起来很贵。

en: I will see to it that you meet her at the party.
zh: 我会确保你在聚会上见到她。

en: Say what you will, I think he is an honest person.
zh: 随便你怎么说，我认为他是个诚实的人。

en: I will help him no matter what you say.
zh: 不管你怎么说，我都会帮助他。

en: Say what you will; I won't change my mind.
zh: 随便你怎么说，我都不会改变主意。

en: I marvel how you could agree to the proposal.
zh: 我很惊讶你怎么会同意这个提议。

en: It is obvious why you have a stomach-ache.
zh: 你为什么肚子疼，这很明显。

en: I can imagine how you felt.
zh: 我能想象你的感受。

en: However fast you may walk, you can't catch up with him.
zh: 无论你走得多快，你也赶不上他。

en: Try as you may, you will not be able to read as many as five novels in a day.
zh: 无论你怎么努力，你一天也读不了五本小说。

en: Try to estimate how much you spent on books.
zh: 试着估计一下你在书上花了多少钱。

en: I have a good mind to strike you for being so rude.
zh: 我很想打你，因为你太粗鲁了。

en: No matter where you may go, don't forget to write to me.
zh: 无论你去哪里，都不要忘记给我写信。

en: I must go there irrespective of what you think.
zh: 不管你怎么想，我都必须去那里。

en: You should have nothing to complain about.
zh: 你应该没有什么可抱怨的。

en: No wonder you could not open the door.
zh: 难怪你打不开门。

en: What is it that makes you think that way?
zh: 是什么让你那样想？

en: I'm surprised at your behavior.
zh: 我对你的行为感到惊讶。

en: It's strange you say that.
zh: 你说的真奇怪。

en: I will do my best to put such an idea out of your head.
zh: 我会尽力让你打消这个念头。

en: How can I feel relaxed, with you watching me like that?
zh: 你那样盯着我，我怎么能放松呢？

en: I can't abide hearing you cry so bitterly.
zh: 我受不了听你哭得这么伤心。

en: It is outrageous that you should spend so much money.
zh: 你花这么多钱真是太离谱了。

en: It is a pity that you should lose such a chance.
zh: 你失去这样的机会真是太可惜了。

en: It is foolish of you to believe such a thing.
zh: 你相信这种事真是太傻了。

en: It's absurd of you to do that.
zh: 你这样做真是太荒谬了。

en: It is absurd of you to do that.
zh: 你那样做真是荒谬。

en: It is no use your trying to deny it.
zh: 你试图否认它也是没用的。

en: It is a great pity that you don't know it.
zh: 你不知道这件事真是太可惜了。

en: It makes no difference to me whether you believe it or not.
zh: 你信不信对我来说都无所谓。

en: It makes little difference to me whether you believe it or not.
zh: 你信不信对我来说没什么区别。

en: It is right that you should write it.
zh: 你写它是对的。

en: The day will come when you will realize it.
zh: 总有一天你会意识到这件事的。

en: The time will come when you'll regret it.
zh: 总有一天你会后悔的。

en: I'm glad you liked it.
zh: 我很高兴你喜欢它。

en: You are mad to try to do it all alone.
zh: 你独自一人尝试做这件事真是疯了。

en: I wish you had not told the story to my mother.
zh: 我真希望你没有把这件事告诉我妈妈。

en: When was it that you visited the museum?
zh: 你是什么时候参观博物馆的？

en: It is no wonder that you are turning down the proposal.
zh: 你拒绝这个提议一点也不奇怪。

en: What made it difficult for you to carry out the plan?
zh: 是什么让你难以执行这个计划？

en: It is absolutely necessary that you be at the meeting.
zh: 你务必参加会议。

en: You have no good reason for thinking as you do.
zh: 你没有理由那样想。

en: I cannot believe you did not see him then.
zh: 我简直不敢相信你当时没看见他。

en: Ten to one you can pass the test.
zh: 十有八九你能通过考试。

en: The time will come when you will be sorry for it.
zh: 总有一天你会为此感到后悔的。

en: I'll do it, if you insist.
zh: 如果你坚持，我就做。

en: I can't work with you standing there.
zh: 你站在那里我没法工作。

en: By the time you got there, the sun had set.
zh: 等你到那里的时候，太阳已经下山了。

en: You gave me a real surprise when you showed up there.
zh: 你出现在那里真是让我大吃一惊。

en: Since you say so.
zh: 既然你这么说。

en: You may well say so, but I cannot agree.
zh: 你这么说也许没错，但我不能同意。

en: There is no reason why you shouldn't do such a thing.
zh: 你没有任何理由不做这件事。

en: I don't blame you.
zh: 我不怪你。

en: I can't allow you to do that.
zh: 我不能允许你那样做。

en: There are a good many reasons why you shouldn't do it.
zh: 你有很多理由不应该那样做。

en: I don't blame you for doing that.
zh: 我不怪你做这件事。

en: We will pay you according to the amount of work you do.
zh: 我们会根据你的工作量付给你工资。

en: I'm glad you enjoy skiing, but I guess it's just not my cup of tea.
zh: 我很高兴你喜欢滑雪，但我想这不适合我。

en: I'll do everything you tell me to do.
zh: 我会做你告诉我的所有事情。

en: Your conduct is absolutely shameful.
zh: 你的行为太可耻了。

en: I cannot see you behaving like that.
zh: 我无法接受你那样的行为。

en: I didn't expect you to get here so soon.
zh: 我没想到你这么快就到了。

en: It was too bad you couldn't come.
zh: 你没能来真是太可惜了。

en: It's a pity that you couldn't come.
zh: 你没能来真是太遗憾了。

en: It is easy for you to solve this problem.
zh: 你很容易解决这个问题。

en: You wrote this book?
zh: 这本书是你写的？

en: I didn't know that you were in this town.
zh: 我不知道你在这个镇上。

en: It is dangerous for you to swim in this river.
zh: 你在这条河里游泳很危险。

en: It is out of the question for you to go to New York this weekend.
zh: 你这个周末去纽约是不可能的。

en: It is very difficult for you to do this work.
zh: 你做这项工作非常困难。

en: The time will come when you will understand this.
zh: 总有一天你会明白这个的。

en: Where was it that you found this key?
zh: 你是在哪里找到这把钥匙的？

en: I didn't expect you to turn up here.
zh: 我没想到你会出现在这里。

en: There is no need for you to stay here.
zh: 你没有必要留在这里。

en: As long as you're here, I'll stay.
zh: 只要你在这里，我就会留下。

en: With you here beside me I'm not afraid of anything. You're my fortress.
zh: 有你在我身边，我什么都不怕。你就是我的堡垒。

en: The watch you gave me doesn't keep time.
zh: 你送我的手表不准了。

en: I had no notion that you were coming.
zh: 我一点也不知道你要来。

en: My life would be completely empty without you.
zh: 我的生活如果没有你，将会完全空虚。

en: You'll be missed by your friends.
zh: 你的朋友们会想念你的。

en: We shall all miss you when you go away.
zh: 你离开后，我们都会想念你的。

en: I miss you badly.
zh: 我非常想你。

en: How I miss you.
zh: 我多么想你啊。

en: I miss you very much.
zh: 我非常想你。

en: We all miss you very much.
zh: 我们大家都非常想你。

en: We will miss you badly.
zh: 我们会非常想念你的。

en: Whenever you come, I'm ready.
zh: 无论你什么时候来，我都准备好了。

en: It is because you work too much that you are sleepy all the time.
zh: 你总是犯困是因为你工作太努力了。

en: Why is it that you are always late?
zh: 你为什么总是迟到？

en: You may stay here as long as you like.
zh: 你想在这里待多久都可以。

en: You can talk until you're blue in the face, but you'll never convince me.
zh: 就算你说破嘴，你也说服不了我。

en: Laugh as much as you like; I'll stick to my plan to the bitter end.
zh: 你随便笑吧，我还是会坚持我的计划到底。

en: I cannot endure your going.
zh: 我无法忍受你的离去。

en: You walk too fast for me to keep up with you.
zh: 你走得太快了，我跟不上你。

en: If only you had told me the whole story at that time!
zh: 要是你当时把整个故事都告诉我该多好啊！

en: It is impossible for you to jump two meters high.
zh: 你不可能跳过两米高。

en: We think it is very dangerous that you're climbing the mountain alone.
zh: 我们认为你独自爬山非常危险。

en: Here is a letter for you.
zh: 这是给你的信。

en: Are you saying that our plan was accepted? I hope you're not showing me any premature happiness here.
zh: 你是说我们的计划被接受了吗？我希望你不是在让我空欢喜一场。

en: You, be quiet!
zh: 你，安静点！

en: Have you ever seen Mt. Fuji? It is beautiful beyond description.
zh: 你见过富士山吗？它美得难以形容。

en: You've filled out.
zh: 你填写好了。

en: What time will you leave?
zh: 你什么时候离开？

en: You don't understand.
zh: 你不明白。

en: You can do this with ease.
zh: 你可以轻松做到。

en: You come here.
zh: 你来这里。

en: Repetition helps you remember something.
zh: 重复有助于你记住某事。

en: Chestnuts have to be boiled for at least fifteen minutes.
zh: 栗子至少要煮十五分钟。

en: A bear will not touch a dead body.
zh: 熊不会碰死尸。

en: A bear can climb a tree.
zh: 熊会爬树。

en: The bear left no stone unturned in his search for fat bugs under the rocks.
zh: 为了寻找岩石下肥美的虫子，熊竭尽全力，不遗余力。

en: Bears also tend to sleep more during the day than at night, although in the summer, with twenty-four hours of light, this does not apply.
zh: 熊也倾向于白天比晚上睡得更多，尽管在夏天，有24小时的光照，这不适用。

en: How long does a bear sleep?
zh: 熊睡多久？

en: The bear began tearing at the tent.
zh: 熊开始撕扯帐篷。

en: When bears sleep or lie down, their postures depend on whether they want to get rid of heat or conserve it.
zh: 当熊睡觉或躺下时，它们的姿势取决于它们是想散热还是保存热量。

en: No one noticed the bear's appearance.
zh: 没有人注意到熊的出现。

en: Take off your socks, please.
zh: 请脱掉你的袜子。

en: Stockings should be of the proper size.
zh: 袜子应该尺寸合适。

en: Are my socks dry already?
zh: 我的袜子已经干了吗？

en: There is a hole in your sock.
zh: 你的袜子有个洞。

en: There are fashions for socks as well.
zh: 袜子也有流行款式。

en: Put on your shoes. Let's go out for dinner.
zh: 穿上你的鞋子。我们出去吃晚饭吧。

en: Please put on your shoes.
zh: 请穿上你的鞋子。

en: Put on your shoes.
zh: 穿上你的鞋子。

en: Before buying shoes, you should try them on.
zh: 买鞋之前，你应该试穿一下。

en: Take off your shoes.
zh: 脱掉你的鞋子。

en: Please take off your shoes.
zh: 请脱鞋。

en: Please remove your shoes before entering the house.
zh: 请进屋前脱鞋。

en: I bought a pair of shoes.
zh: 我买了一双鞋。

en: Give my shoes a good shine.
zh: 把我的鞋擦亮。

en: The shoelace came untied.
zh: 鞋带开了。

en: Your shoes need brushing. They are muddy.
zh: 你的鞋需要刷一下，太脏了，都是泥。

en: Shoes are stiff when they are new.
zh: 新鞋很硬。

en: Shoes are sold in pairs.
zh: 鞋是成双出售的。

en: Where're the shoes?
zh: 鞋在哪里？

en: You must keep your shoes clean.
zh: 你必须保持鞋子干净。

en: How soon can I have my shoes mended?
zh: 我的鞋多久能修好？

en: Tie your shoelaces.
zh: 系好你的鞋带。

en: Gum got stuck to the bottom of my shoe.
zh: 口香糖粘在我的鞋底了。

en: The soles of my shoes are worn.
zh: 我的鞋底磨损了。

en: Brush off the dust from your shoes.
zh: 把鞋上的灰尘刷掉。

en: What size shoes do you wear?
zh: 你穿多大码的鞋？

en: My shoes hurt. I'm in agony.
zh: 我的鞋子很疼，我难受死了。

en: Your feet are swollen because your shoes are too small.
zh: 你的脚肿了，因为你的鞋太小了。

en: Please remove the mud from your shoes.
zh: 请把鞋上的泥弄掉。

en: I'd like some shoes.
zh: 我想要买些鞋。

en: My shoes are worn out.
zh: 我的鞋穿坏了。

en: The shoes are worn out.
zh: 这鞋穿坏了。

en: These shoes are too tight. They hurt.
zh: 这鞋太紧了，穿着疼。

en: It's a catch.
zh: 这是一个圈套。

en: I would rather die than live in dishonor.
zh: 我宁愿死也不愿苟且偷生。

en: The Sumida is not a good river for us to swim in any more.
zh: 隅田川已经不再适合我们游泳了。

en: Could we have a table in the corner?
zh: 我们可以在角落里要一张桌子吗？

en: Don't leave it up to chance.
zh: 不要碰运气。

en: The man in the corner addressed himself to the husband.
zh: 角落里的那个人对丈夫说话。

en: I met her by accident.
zh: 我偶然遇到了她。

en: By chance we saw him as he came out of the shop.
zh: 我们碰巧看到他从商店里出来。

en: It just so happened that Mr Yamada came from the same town.
zh: 碰巧山田先生来自同一个城镇。

en: It is true that he did it, whether by accident or by design.
zh: 他的确做了这件事，不管是偶然还是故意的。

en: What a coincidence!
zh: 真是太巧了！

en: I just came up with the word.
zh: 我刚想到这个词。

en: I found the book by accident.
zh: 我偶然发现了这本书。

en: I found that restaurant by accident.
zh: 我偶然发现了那家餐馆。

en: I met her by chance.
zh: 我偶然遇到了她。

en: I happened to witness the bullying in the corridor.
zh: 我碰巧目睹了走廊里的霸凌事件。

en: By chance, I met her in the street.
zh: 偶然地，我在街上遇到了她。

en: By chance I met my ex-girlfriend in Portugal.
zh: 我在葡萄牙偶然遇到了我的前女友。

en: It happened that I saw my friend walking in the distance.
zh: 碰巧我看到我的朋友在远处走着。

en: Even times odd is even, odd times odd is odd.
zh: 偶数乘以奇数是偶数，奇数乘以奇数是奇数。

en: The sky promises fair weather.
zh: 天空预示着好天气。

en: The sky looks angry.
zh: 天空看起来很阴沉。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it will be fine tomorrow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，明天会是好天气。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain at any moment.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，可能随时会下雨。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, we may have snow tomorrow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，明天可能会下雪。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it is going to snow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，要下雪了。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain this afternoon.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，今天下午可能会下雨。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it will clear up in the afternoon.
zh: 看这天色，下午会转晴。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it is likely to rain.
zh: 看这天色，很可能会下雨。

en: Judging from the sky, it will rain soon.
zh: 看这天，很快就要下雨了。

en: From the look of the sky, it may begin to snow tonight.
zh: 看这天色，今晚可能会开始下雪。

en: From the look of the sky I'm afraid the rain won't let up for a while.
zh: 看这天色，恐怕这雨一时半会儿停不了。

en: I felt hungry.
zh: 我感到饿了。

en: With hunger and fatigue, the dog died at last.
zh: 这条狗最终因饥饿和疲劳而死。

en: Hunger is one of the greatest social miseries.
zh: 饥饿是最大的社会苦难之一。

en: Hunger is the best sauce.
zh: 饥饿是最好的调味品。

en: He cannot be hungry; he has just had lunch.
zh: 他不可能饿，他刚吃过午饭。

en: Hunger compelled the boy to steal money from the cash register.
zh: 饥饿迫使这个男孩从收银机里偷钱。

en: Hunger drove him to steal.
zh: 饥饿驱使他去偷窃。

en: It is a shameful fact that, while there are lands where people suffer from hunger, within Japan there are many households and restaurants where much food is thrown away.
zh: 一个可耻的事实是，在一些地方的人们遭受饥饿之苦的同时，日本国内却有很多家庭和餐馆浪费大量的食物。

en: Hungry and thirsty, we at last reached the inn.
zh: 我们又饿又渴，终于到达了旅馆。

en: He has a hungry look.
zh: 他看起来很饥饿。

en: My stomach is clenched with hunger.
zh: 我饿得肚子都绞痛了。

en: I must make up for lost time.
zh: 我必须弥补失去的时间。

en: Fantasy is often the mother of art.
zh: 幻想往往是艺术之母。

en: Our house was robbed while we were away.
zh: 我们不在家的时候，房子被盗了。

en: In his fantasy, he imagined he was a famous writer.
zh: 在他的幻想中，他想象自己是一位著名的作家。

en: With the power of imagination, we can even travel through space.
zh: 凭借想象力，我们甚至可以穿越太空。

en: Are seats available?
zh: 有空位吗？

en: There is no sense in standing when there are seats available.
zh: 有空位的时候站着是没有意义的。

en: Fill in the blanks.
zh: 填空。

en: Fill in the blanks with suitable words.
zh: 用合适的词语填空。

en: Karate is an art of unarmed defense.
zh: 空手道是一种徒手防御的艺术。

en: You are hearing things.
zh: 你听错了吧。

en: I saw a flock of birds flying aloft.
zh: 我看到一群鸟在空中飞翔。

en: Where can I get a shuttle bus at the airport?
zh: 在机场哪里可以搭乘机场巴士？

en: I'll drive you to the airport.
zh: 我开车送你去机场。

en: I arranged for a car to meet you at the airport.
zh: 我安排了一辆车在机场接你。

en: May I accompany you to the airport?
zh: 我可以陪你去机场吗？

en: How much will it cost to get to the airport?
zh: 去机场要多少钱？

en: How far is it to the airport?
zh: 到机场有多远？

en: How long do you think it will take to go to the airport?
zh: 你觉得去机场要多久？

en: I'll accompany you to the airport.
zh: 我陪你去机场。

en: Let's stay somewhere with easy airport access.
zh: 我们找一个去机场方便的地方住吧。

en: Where does the airport bus leave from?
zh: 机场巴士在哪里出发？

en: Please tell me how to get to the airport.
zh: 请告诉我怎么去机场。

en: I went to the airport by taxi.
zh: 我坐出租车去了机场。

en: You should allow an hour to go to the airport.
zh: 你应该预留一个小时去机场。

en: I could've met you at the airport.
zh: 我本来可以去机场接你的。

en: The airport was closed because of the fog.
zh: 因为雾，机场关闭了。

en: Where can I get the airport bus?
zh: 在哪里可以搭乘机场巴士？

en: Where do I get an airport bus?
zh: 我在哪里可以搭乘机场巴士？

en: How long does the airport bus take to the airport?
zh: 机场巴士到机场要多久？

en: The airport is close at hand.
zh: 机场就在附近。

en: I prefer a hotel by the airport.
zh: 我更喜欢机场附近的酒店。

en: As soon as he arrived at the airport, he phoned his office.
zh: 他一到机场，就给办公室打了电话。

en: Arriving at the airport, I saw the plane taking off.
zh: 到达机场时，我看到飞机正在起飞。

en: I'll phone you as soon as I get to the airport.
zh: 我一到机场就给你打电话。

en: Upon arriving at the airport, he said, "I'm glad I could come back."
zh: 一到机场，他说：“我很高兴能回来。”

en: Arriving at the airport, I called her up.
zh: 到达机场后，我给她打了电话。

en: I had a hard time getting to the airport.
zh: 我去机场很不容易。

en: I have to go to the airport to meet my family.
zh: 我得去机场接我的家人。

en: There were a great many people at the airport.
zh: 机场有很多人。

en: There were hundreds of taxis at the airport, all touting for business.
zh: 机场有数百辆出租车，都在招揽生意。

en: What time should I go to the airport?
zh: 我应该几点去机场？

en: Upon arriving at the airport, he made a phonecall to his wife.
zh: 一到机场，他就给妻子打了个电话。

en: Please pick me up at the airport at five.
zh: 请五点到机场接我。

en: We saw her off at the airport.
zh: 我们在机场为她送行。

en: The long wait at the airport was tedious.
zh: 在机场漫长的等待很无聊。

en: A time bomb went off in the airport killing thirteen people.
zh: 机场发生了一起定时炸弹爆炸事件，造成十三人死亡。

en: They shook hands when they met at the airport.
zh: 他们在机场见面时握了手。

en: Please tell me which railway line to use from the airport to downtown.
zh: 请告诉我从机场到市中心应该乘坐哪条铁路线。

en: How long does it take to your office from the airport?
zh: 从机场到你的办公室要多久？

en: Is there a shuttle bus between the hotel and airport?
zh: 酒店和机场之间有穿梭巴士吗？

en: How far is it from the airport to the hotel?
zh: 从机场到酒店有多远？

en: Is it possible to take a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel?
zh: 是否可以乘坐从机场到酒店的穿梭巴士？

en: To live without air is impossible.
zh: 没有空气就无法生存。

en: Oxygen from the air dissolves in water.
zh: 空气中的氧气溶解在水中。

en: Tiny particles in the air can cause cancer.
zh: 空气中的微小颗粒会导致癌症。

en: Because of the problem of air pollution, the bicycle may some day replace the automobile.
zh: 由于空气污染问题，自行车可能有一天会取代汽车。

en: Air is a mixture of gases that we cannot see.
zh: 空气是我们看不见的气体混合物。

en: Air is invisible.
zh: 空气是无形的。

en: Air is a mixture of several gases.
zh: 空气是几种气体的混合物。

en: Air, like food, is a basic human need.
zh: 空气和食物一样，是人类的基本需求。

en: The air was infected with photochemical smog.
zh: 空气受到了光化学烟雾的污染。

en: Air is a mixture of gases.
zh: 空气是气体的混合物。

en: The air is a medium for sound.
zh: 空气是声音的传播介质。

en: The air is soft, the soil moist.
zh: 空气柔软，土壤湿润。

en: Air is a mixture of various gases.
zh: 空气是各种气体的混合物。

en: Air is indispensable to life.
zh: 空气对生命是不可或缺的。

en: As for the air, there is always some moisture in the atmosphere, but when the amount increases a great deal, it affects the light waves.
zh: 至于空气，大气中总是含有一些水分，但是当水分大量增加时，会影响光波。

en: Air quality has deteriorated these past few years.
zh: 这几年空气质量恶化了。

en: The idea that air has weight was surprising to the child.
zh: 空气有重量这个概念让孩子感到惊讶。

en: We cannot live without air.
zh: 没有空气我们就无法生存。

en: Both air and water are indispensable for life.
zh: 空气和水对生命都是不可或缺的。

en: If it were not for air and water, we could not live.
zh: 如果没有空气和水，我们就无法生存。

en: Without air and water, nothing could live.
zh: 没有空气和水，任何生物都无法生存。

en: Air is to man what water is to fish.
zh: 空气之于人类，犹如水之于鱼。

en: If it were not for air, we could not live on the earth.
zh: 如果没有空气，我们就无法在地球上生存。

en: The balloon descended gradually as the air came out.
zh: 随着空气的排出，气球逐渐下降。

en: The air became warm.
zh: 空气变得温暖起来。

en: Were it not for air, no creatures could live.
zh: 如果没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: No living thing could live without air.
zh: 没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: Without air, nothing could live.
zh: 没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: We would die without air.
zh: 没有空气我们会死亡。

en: But for air, nothing could live.
zh: 如果没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: It is clear that we cannot live without air.
zh: 很明显，没有空气我们就无法生存。

en: If there were no air, man could not live even ten minutes.
zh: 如果没有空气，人活不到十分钟。

en: If it were not for air, we could not live.
zh: 如果没有空气，我们就无法生存。

en: But for air, all living things would die.
zh: 如果没有空气，所有生物都会死亡。

en: Without air there can be no wind or sound on the moon.
zh: 没有空气，月球上就不会有风或声音。

en: A bat flying in the sky looks like a butterfly.
zh: 在天空中飞行的蝙蝠看起来像蝴蝶。

en: Seen against the sky, the mountain looked really beautiful.
zh: 在天空的映衬下，这座山看起来非常美丽。

en: It is difficult to shoot a bird flying in the air.
zh: 很难射击一只在空中飞行的鸟。

en: Who is looking up into the sky?
zh: 谁在仰望天空？

en: The skies promise better weather in the morning.
zh: 天空预示着明天会有更好的天气。

en: Look up to the skies.
zh: 抬头看看天空。

en: A balloon is ascending into the sky.
zh: 一个气球正在升入天空。

en: The sky was fiery with the setting sun.
zh: 夕阳将天空染成火红色。

en: The sky was as clear as ever.
zh: 天空一如既往地晴朗。

en: The sky is becoming cloudy.
zh: 天空变得多云了。

en: The sky is blue.
zh: 天空是蓝色的。

en: The sky is clear and the sun is bright.
zh: 天空晴朗，阳光明媚。

en: The sky was bright and clear.
zh: 天空晴朗明亮。

en: The sky is full of stars.
zh: 天空布满了星星。

en: The sky is over our heads.
zh: 天空在我们头顶上方。

en: The sky grew darker and darker.
zh: 天空变得越来越暗。

en: The sky was ablaze with fireworks.
zh: 天空被烟花照亮。

en: The sky is covered with clouds.
zh: 天空布满了云。

en: The sky clouded over.
zh: 天空阴云密布。

en: The sky was completely dark.
zh: 天空一片漆黑。

en: The sky grew darker and darker, and the wind blew harder and harder.
zh: 天空变得越来越暗，风也越来越大。

en: The sky is clear almost every day.
zh: 几乎每天天空都是晴朗的。

en: The sky is a hazy shade of winter.
zh: 天空是冬天朦胧的灰色。

en: The sky became darker and darker.
zh: 天空变得越来越暗。

en: The sky misted over.
zh: 天空变得雾蒙蒙的。

en: The sky will soon clear up.
zh: 天空很快就会放晴。

en: He is as rich as any man in this town.
zh: 他像镇上任何人一样富有。

en: The sky is as blue as blue can be.
zh: 天空蓝得不能再蓝了。

en: There is nothing like air travel.
zh: 没有什么能比得上空中旅行。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as traveling by air.
zh: 没有什么比乘飞机旅行更令人愉快了。

en: Air travel is fast; sea travel is, however, restful.
zh: 空中旅行很快；然而，海上旅行是令人放松的。

en: Empty vessels make the most sound.
zh: 空瓶子响声最大。

en: His plane leaves for Hong Kong at 2:00 p.m.
zh: 他的飞机下午两点飞往香港。

en: I want a few empty glasses.
zh: 我想要几个空杯子。

en: Find an empty bottle and fill it with water.
zh: 找一个空瓶子，装满水。

en: The clouds floating in the sky are beautiful.
zh: 漂浮在天空中的云朵很漂亮。

en: A beautiful rainbow is spanning the sky.
zh: 一道美丽的彩虹横跨天空。

en: Were there any stars in the sky?
zh: 天空中有什么星星吗？

en: We can see thousands of stars in the sky.
zh: 我们可以在天空中看到成千上万颗星星。

en: I saw something strange in the sky.
zh: 我在天空中看到了一些奇怪的东西。

en: There wasn't a cloud in the sky.
zh: 天空中没有一丝云彩。

en: There were countless stars in the sky.
zh: 天空中布满了无数的星星。

en: Countless stars were twinkling in the sky.
zh: 无数的星星在天空中闪烁。

en: The sun is shining in the sky.
zh: 太阳在天空中照耀。

en: Numerous stars were visible in the sky.
zh: 天空中可以看到许多星星。

en: There are so many stars in the sky, I can't count them all.
zh: 天空中有很多星星，我数不清。

en: The sky was full of stars.
zh: 天空繁星点点。

en: Not a star was to be seen in the sky.
zh: 天空中一颗星星也看不见。

en: There are more stars in the sky than I can count.
zh: 天上的星星多得数不清。

en: There were several stars to be seen in the sky.
zh: 天空中可以看到几颗星星。

en: There are billions of stars in the sky.
zh: 天空中有着数十亿颗星星。

en: There isn't a single cloud in the sky.
zh: 天空万里无云。

en: Not a single cloud could be seen in the sky.
zh: 天空中看不到一片云。

en: There was not a cloud in the sky.
zh: 天空没有一丝云彩。

en: There is a mass of dark clouds in the sky.
zh: 天空乌云密布。

en: There were a lot of stars seen in the sky.
zh: 天空中看到了许多星星。

en: Many stars were shining in the heavens.
zh: 许多星星在天空中闪耀。

en: You can see a lot of stars in the sky.
zh: 你可以在天空中看到很多星星。

en: The contrast between the sky and the mountain is striking.
zh: 天空和山之间的对比非常鲜明。

en: Birds were singing in the sky.
zh: 鸟儿在天空中歌唱。

en: We have three spare rooms, none of which can be used.
zh: 我们有三间空余的房间，但都不能用。

en: Empty cans were scattered about the place.
zh: 空罐子散落在各处。

en: Drinking on an empty stomach is bad for your health.
zh: 空腹喝酒对你的健康有害。

en: The brightness of the sky showed that the storm had passed.
zh: 天空的明亮表明暴风雨已经过去了。

en: The sky has brightened.
zh: 天空放晴了。

en: Do you know the reason why the sky looks blue?
zh: 你知道天空为什么看起来是蓝色的吗？

en: The sky has become clear.
zh: 天空变得晴朗了。

en: The sky seemed to blend with the sea.
zh: 天空似乎与大海融为一体。

en: The sky has become overcast.
zh: 天空变得阴沉了。

en: The sky is getting dark.
zh: 天空正在变暗。

en: Seen from the sky, the bridge appears more beautiful.
zh: 从空中看，这座桥显得更加美丽。

en: Seen from the sky, the river looked like a huge snake.
zh: 从天空上看，这条河看起来像一条巨大的蛇。

en: The houses and cars looked tiny from the sky.
zh: 从天空上看，房子和汽车看起来很小。

en: The whole sky lit up and there was an explosion.
zh: 整个天空都亮了起来，然后发生了爆炸。

en: Seen from the sky, the island was very beautiful.
zh: 从天空上看，这个岛屿非常美丽。

en: The sky brightened.
zh: 天空变亮了。

en: The sky has gradually clouded over.
zh: 天空渐渐阴沉下来了。

en: Is there a vacant seat?
zh: 请问有空位吗？

en: The only room available is a double.
zh: 唯一可用的房间是双人间。

en: Do you have any vacancies?
zh: 你们有空房吗？

en: Stop grumbling.
zh: 别发牢骚了。

en: A fool's bolt is soon shot.
zh: 傻瓜的箭很快就射完了。（比喻：傻瓜很快就会用完他的伎俩或资源）

en: It is easy to be wise after the event.
zh: 事后诸葛亮容易当。

en: Who lives without folly is not so wise as he thinks.
zh: 谁自认为没有犯过傻，那他肯定没自己想的那么聪明。

en: A fool and his money are soon parted.
zh: 傻瓜的钱很快就会被骗走。

en: His parents' view was that he was wasting his earnings on a silly girl.
zh: 他的父母认为他把挣来的钱浪费在一个愚蠢的女孩身上。

en: You've acted foolishly and you will pay for it.
zh: 你做了蠢事，你会付出代价的。

en: I want specific information.
zh: 我想要具体的信息。

en: Are you feeling under the weather?
zh: 你觉得不舒服吗？

en: Take this medicine in case you get sick.
zh: 以防你生病，把这药吃了。

en: Is anything the matter with him?
zh: 他有什么问题吗？

en: I'm sick. Will you send for a doctor?
zh: 我生病了。你能请个医生来吗？

en: You are doing well for a cub reporter.
zh: 作为一个刚入行的新记者，你做得不错。

en: No pain, no gain.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Cares and worries were pervasive in her mind.
zh: 忧虑和烦恼弥漫在她的脑海里。

en: No gains without pains.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: No cross, no crown.
zh: 不经历风雨，怎能见彩虹。

en: No gain without pains.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Toil and worry caused his health to break down.
zh: 劳累和忧虑损害了他的健康。

en: If you're not prepared to take the trouble to learn how to train a dog, don't get one.
zh: 如果你不准备费心学习如何训练狗，就别养狗。

en: All my troubles came to nothing.
zh: 我所有的烦恼都白费了。

en: We arrived at that plan out of pure desperation, but the book sold well.
zh: 我们出于绝望才制定了那个计划，但这本书卖得很好。

en: I cannot bear the pain any more.
zh: 我再也无法忍受这种痛苦了。

en: His face is distorted by pain.
zh: 他的脸因痛苦而扭曲。

en: After all the trouble we went to in coming up with that project, it only took them a second to shoot it down in the meeting.
zh: 我们费了那么大的劲才想出那个项目，结果他们在会议上只用了一秒钟就否决了。

en: That was well worth the trouble.
zh: 那非常值得付出努力。

en: Make sure that the complaints are dealt with as quickly as possible.
zh: 确保尽快处理这些投诉。

en: No pain, no gains.
zh: 没有付出，就没有收获。

en: It helps us in times of difficulty.
zh: 它在困难时期帮助我们。

en: It is man's lot to suffer.
zh: 受苦是人的命运。

en: It's so painful. Stop it!
zh: 太疼了。 停下来！

en: Danger past, God forgotten.
zh: 渡过难关就忘记神。

en: No sweet without sweat.
zh: 不付出汗水就没有甜蜜。

en: The 1990's saw various incidents.
zh: 20世纪90年代发生过各种事件。

en: The bus service is not good between nine and ten.
zh: 九点到十点之间的巴士服务不好。

en: I make it a rule not to watch television after nine o'clock.
zh: 我有个规矩，九点以后不看电视。

en: I'd like you to come at nine.
zh: 我希望你九点来。

en: I escaped death.
zh: 我死里逃生。

en: Have you ever had a narrow escape?
zh: 你有没有经历过死里逃生？

en: By September the burst in spending seemed to be tapering off.
zh: 到九月份，消费热潮似乎正在减退。

en: By September I will have known her for a whole year.
zh: 到九月份，我就认识她整整一年了。

en: Open your book to page nine.
zh: 请把书翻到第九页。

en: There is a shuttle bus that goes to the Ginza Tokyu Hotel.
zh: 有一辆班车去银座东急酒店。

en: I ran into a friend while walking in Ginza.
zh: 我在银座散步时遇到了一个朋友。

en: Is the Ginza the busiest street in Japan?
zh: 银座是日本最繁华的街道吗？

en: We will make the payment by bank transfer.
zh: 我们将通过银行转账付款。

en: The bank robbers dispersed in all directions.
zh: 银行劫匪向四面八方逃散。

en: Bank robbery will cost you ten years in prison.
zh: 抢劫银行会让你坐十年牢。

en: I'm looking for a bank. Is there one near here?
zh: 我在找银行。这附近有银行吗？

en: I've been to the bank.
zh: 我去过银行了。

en: Can you tell me the way to the bank?
zh: 你能告诉我怎么去银行吗？

en: You'll see the bank on the left hand side of the hospital.
zh: 你会在医院的左手边看到银行。

en: A bank lends us money at interest.
zh: 银行以利息借钱给我们。

en: The bank holds a mortgage on his building.
zh: 银行拥有他的建筑物的抵押权。

en: The bank accommodated him with a loan of 10,000 yen.
zh: 银行为他提供了1万日元的贷款。

en: The bank loaned him 500 dollars.
zh: 银行借给他500美元。

en: The bank isn't open on Sundays.
zh: 银行星期天不开门。

en: The bank keeps money for people.
zh: 银行替人们保管钱。

en: Banks are cutting lending to industrial borrowers.
zh: 银行正在削减对工业借款人的贷款。

en: The bank loaned the company $1 million.
zh: 银行借给该公司一百万美元。

en: The bank reassured us that our money was safe.
zh: 银行向我们保证我们的钱是安全的。

en: The bank came through with the loan we had requested.
zh: 银行批准了我们要求的贷款。

en: How late is the bank open?
zh: 银行开到几点？

en: What are the banking hours?
zh: 银行的营业时间是什么时候？

en: Banks charge higher interest on loans to risky customers.
zh: 银行对风险较高的客户收取更高的贷款利息。

en: The bank accommodated the company with a loan.
zh: 银行向该公司提供了贷款。

en: Is the bank open?
zh: 银行开门了吗？

en: Banks open at nine o'clock.
zh: 银行九点开门。

en: The bank is three blocks away.
zh: 银行在三个街区之外。

en: I recognized the bank teller as the man I had seen in the movie theater.
zh: 我认出银行柜员就是我在电影院见过的那个男人。

en: I ran across an old friend near the bank.
zh: 我在银行附近偶遇一位老朋友。

en: I've got to get some money somehow to repay the bank loan.
zh: 我必须想办法弄到一些钱来偿还银行贷款。

en: You'll have to get off at the bank and take the A52.
zh: 你必须在银行下车，然后乘坐A52路。

en: Some people do not like to deposit their money in banks.
zh: 有些人不喜欢把钱存在银行里。

en: The balance at the bank stands at two million yen.
zh: 银行的余额是两百万日元。

en: Please go to the bank.
zh: 请去银行。

en: We must ask the bank for the loan.
zh: 我们必须向银行申请贷款。

en: The bank will cash your fifty dollar check.
zh: 银行会兑现你五十美元的支票。

en: While employed at the bank, he taught economics at college.
zh: 他在银行工作期间，还在大学教经济学。

en: I'm afraid the bank is going to repossess my house.
zh: 恐怕银行要收回我的房子了。

en: How much money do you have in the bank?
zh: 你在银行里有多少钱？

en: Please deposit the money in a bank.
zh: 请把钱存入银行。

en: When you put money in the bank, you deposit it.
zh: 当你把钱存入银行时，你就存款了。

en: I made a deposit of $1,000 at the bank.
zh: 我在银行存了1000美元。

en: Banks will try to lend you an umbrella on a sunny day, but they will turn their backs on a rainy day.
zh: 晴天时银行会设法借给你一把伞，雨天时他们却会背弃你。

en: You'll find the shop between a bank and a school.
zh: 你会发现那家商店在银行和学校之间。

en: He works for a bank.
zh: 他在银行工作。

en: I have to withdraw some cash from the bank.
zh: 我必须从银行取一些现金。

en: Please draw a hundred thousand yen from the bank.
zh: 请从银行提取十万日元。

en: A banking scandal is sweeping across Capitol Hill.
zh: 一场银行业丑闻正在席卷国会山。

en: How do you expect to weather the financial storm when the bank refuses to extend a helping hand?
zh: 当银行拒绝伸出援手时，你打算如何度过金融风暴？

en: I have to take some money out of the bank.
zh: 我得从银行取点钱。

en: Do you have any idea when the bank closes?
zh: 你知道银行几点关门吗？

en: There are innumerable stars in the galaxy.
zh: 银河系里有无数颗星星。

en: Can you distinguish silver from tin?
zh: 你能区分银和锡吗？

en: It is difficult to peg the direction of interest deregulation.
zh: 很难确定利率放松管制的走向。

en: Bank lending is rising because of lower interest rates.
zh: 由于利率降低，银行贷款正在增加。

en: Falling interest rates have stimulated the automobile market.
zh: 利率下降刺激了汽车市场。

en: Six percent home loans represent the industry average now.
zh: 百分之六的房屋贷款现在代表行业平均水平。

en: I'm tied up with a project that is due Friday.
zh: 我正忙于一个周五到期的项目。

en: Be sure to telephone by Friday, OK?
zh: 一定要在周五之前打电话，好吗？

en: I need to know your answer by Friday.
zh: 我需要在周五之前知道你的答案。

en: Can you manage to complete the manuscript by Friday?
zh: 你能在周五之前完成手稿吗？

en: He said he would give us his decision for sure by Friday.
zh: 他说他肯定会在周五之前给我们他的决定。

en: Friday is the day when she is very busy.
zh: 星期五是她非常忙碌的一天。

en: Friday is when I am least busy.
zh: 星期五是我最不忙的时候。

en: Read chapter 4 for Friday.
zh: 星期五读第四章。

en: On Friday night, three men came into Mr White's hotel and asked for rooms.
zh: 星期五晚上，三个男人来到怀特先生的旅馆，要了房间。

en: There will be a dance Friday night at the high school.
zh: 星期五晚上高中将举行舞会。

en: There were no tickets available for Friday's performance.
zh: 星期五的演出没有票了。

en: Are you free on Friday afternoon?
zh: 你星期五下午有空吗？

en: The bank shuts late on Fridays.
zh: 银行星期五关门较晚。

en: We can hardly wait for the party on Friday.
zh: 我们迫不及待地想参加星期五的聚会。

en: We're going out for a meal on Friday.
zh: 我们星期五出去吃饭。

en: When Friday comes around, it's time for me to let my hair down and enjoy the weekend.
zh: 当星期五来临的时候，我就该放松一下，享受周末了。

en: A dance will be held on Friday.
zh: 星期五将举行舞会。

en: Is there a table available for two on Friday?
zh: 请问星期五有两人桌吗？

en: A fiscal tightening policy is being enacted.
zh: 正在实行财政紧缩政策。

en: Interest rates will rise due to monetary tightening.
zh: 由于货币紧缩，利率将会上升。

en: Costs of financial services are rising in every country.
zh: 每个国家的金融服务成本都在上升。

en: The Golden Gate Bridge is made of iron.
zh: 金门大桥是由钢铁制成的。

en: How long is the Golden Gate Bridge?
zh: 金门大桥有多长？

en: He will do anything to make money.
zh: 他会不择手段地赚钱。

en: To make money is not the purpose of life.
zh: 赚钱不是人生的目的。

en: Apart from earning money, I have no interest in real estate.
zh: 除了赚钱，我对房地产没有兴趣。

en: We ran short of money.
zh: 我们的钱不够用了。

en: A blonde is speaking to her psychiatrist.
zh: 一个金发女郎正在和她的心理医生说话。

en: A girl with blonde hair came to see you.
zh: 一个金发女孩来找过你。

en: Kanazawa is a quiet city.
zh: 金泽是一个安静的城市。

en: There are sometimes blizzards in Kanazawa.
zh: 金泽有时会有暴风雪。

en: Metal contracts when cooled.
zh: 金属冷却时会收缩。

en: The acid burned the metal.
zh: 酸烧蚀了金属。

en: Love of money is common to all men.
zh: 爱财是人之常情。

en: I think the love of money is common to us all.
zh: 我认为爱财对我们所有人来说都是人之常情。

en: We should not place too much emphasis on money.
zh: 我们不应该过分强调金钱。

en: Money is not a criterion of success.
zh: 金钱不是成功的标准。

en: Money is the measure of worth.
zh: 金钱是衡量价值的标准。

en: Money is the root of all evil.
zh: 金钱是万恶之源。

en: My financial worries are past.
zh: 我的财务烦恼已经过去了。

en: Take part in the activity not for money but for learning through experience.
zh: 参与这项活动不是为了钱，而是为了通过经验学习。

en: I had a quarrel with him over money.
zh: 我因为钱和他吵了一架。

en: Give me your money.
zh: 把你的钱给我。

en: There are many things which we cannot evaluate in terms of money.
zh: 有很多东西是我们无法用金钱来衡量的。

en: The rich have trouble as well as the poor.
zh: 富人也有富人的烦恼。

en: The rich are apt to look down upon the poor.
zh: 富人往往看不起穷人。

en: The rich are not always happy.
zh: 富人并不总是快乐的。

en: The rich are apt to look down on people.
zh: 富人往往看不起人。

en: The rich sometimes despise the poor.
zh: 富人有时会鄙视穷人。

en: The rich are often misers.
zh: 富人常常很吝啬。

en: The rich merchant adopted the boy and made him his heir.
zh: 富商收养了这个男孩，并立他为继承人。

en: The rich have troubles as well as the poor.
zh: 富人也有富人的烦恼。

en: For all his wealth, he is unhappy.
zh: 尽管他很富有，但他并不快乐。

en: If I get rich, I will buy it.
zh: 如果我变有钱，我就买它。

en: Some people identify success with having much money.
zh: 有些人把成功等同于拥有很多钱。

en: I prefer being poor to being rich.
zh: 我宁愿贫穷也不愿富有。

en: The richer he became, the more he wanted.
zh: 他越富有，就越想要更多。

en: He became rich.
zh: 他变得富有了。

en: Do you want to be rich?
zh: 你想变得富有吗？

en: Though she is rich, she is not happy.
zh: 虽然她很富有，但她并不快乐。

en: Were I rich, I would help the poor.
zh: 如果我富有，我会帮助穷人。

en: I wish I were rich.
zh: 我希望我富有。

en: Few rich men own their own property.
zh: 很少有富人拥有自己的财产。

en: He is rich yet he lives like a beggar.
zh: 他很富有，却过着乞丐般的生活。

en: For all his wealth, he is not contented.
zh: 尽管他很富有，但他并不满足。

en: Rich as he is, he is not happy.
zh: 他虽然富有，但他并不快乐。

en: Just because a man is rich it does not necessarily follow that he is happy.
zh: 一个人富有并不一定意味着他快乐。

en: We see things differently according to whether we are rich or poor.
zh: 我们根据贫富不同，看待事物的方式也不同。

en: The rich are not always happier than the poor.
zh: 富人并不总是比穷人更快乐。

en: He may be rich, but he is stingy.
zh: 他可能很富有，但他很吝啬。

en: The papers that were in the safe are gone.
zh: 保险箱里的文件不见了。

en: I put money in a safe.
zh: 我把钱放在保险箱里。

en: Lock the safe.
zh: 锁上保险箱。

en: I'm broke.
zh: 我身无分文。

en: I'm feeding the goldfish.
zh: 我在喂金鱼。

en: Regardless of the amount, Brian wants the correct, entire amount by next week.
zh: 不管金额多少，布莱恩下周之前要拿到正确、完整的金额。

en: The gold coin was much more valuable than was supposed.
zh: 这枚金币比预想的更有价值。

en: There is a gold coin.
zh: 这里有一枚金币。

en: I had to resort to threats to get my money back.
zh: 我不得不采取威胁手段才能要回我的钱。

en: Many men went west in search of gold.
zh: 许多人去西部寻找黄金。

en: Lend your money and lose your friend.
zh: 借钱给朋友，友谊玩完。

en: I should have taken the money.
zh: 我本应该拿走那笔钱的。

en: He who pays the piper calls the tune.
zh: 谁出钱，谁说了算。

en: Get out your wallet.
zh: 拿出你的钱包。

en: I don't want to lend or borrow.
zh: 我不想借钱或贷款。

en: Lend me some money, if you have any.
zh: 如果你有钱，借我一些。

en: It is foolish to equate money with happiness.
zh: 把金钱和幸福划等号是愚蠢的。

en: I will do it on condition that I am paid.
zh: 我会做的，条件是给我报酬。

en: We die whether we make money or not.
zh: 无论我们是否赚钱，我们都会死去。

en: The loss of money made it impossible for him to go abroad.
zh: 失去金钱使他无法出国。

en: It's money down the drain.
zh: 这简直是浪费钱。

en: We must cut our expenses to save money.
zh: 我们必须削减开支来存钱。

en: Some people look down on others because they have less money.
zh: 有些人因为别人钱少就看不起别人。

en: Don't ask for money.
zh: 不要伸手要钱。

en: Making money is his religion.
zh: 赚钱是他的信仰。

en: Health is better than wealth.
zh: 健康胜于财富。

en: I prefer silver rings to gold ones.
zh: 我喜欢银戒指胜过金戒指。

en: No money, no job, no friends. He was truly at loose ends.
zh: 没钱，没工作，没朋友。他真是走投无路了。

en: Money does not grow on trees.
zh: 钱不是从天上掉下来的。

en: I will give you the money tomorrow.
zh: 我明天会给你钱。

en: Money will make the pot boil.
zh: 钱能使鬼推磨。

en: Money comes and goes.
zh: 钱来来去去。

en: Gold is heavier than iron.
zh: 金比铁重。

en: Gold is more precious than iron.
zh: 金比铁更珍贵。

en: The gold was beaten into thin plates.
zh: 金子被打成薄片。

en: Money ruins many.
zh: 金钱会毁掉很多人。

en: Money is a good servant, but a bad master.
zh: 金钱是好的仆人，却是坏的主人。

en: Gold is far heavier than water.
zh: 金比水重得多。

en: The money was hidden beneath the floorboards.
zh: 钱藏在地板下面。

en: Gold is similar in color to brass.
zh: 金的颜色和黄铜相似。

en: I have little money.
zh: 我几乎没有钱。

en: I have a little money.
zh: 我有一点钱。

en: Was the money actually paid?
zh: 这笔钱真的支付了吗？

en: Ready money will away.
zh: 现钱容易花光。

en: Gold is heavier than silver.
zh: 金比银重。

en: Keep the money in a safe place.
zh: 把钱放在安全的地方。

en: I have no money, but I have dreams.
zh: 我没有钱，但我有梦想。

en: Poor as he is, he is generous.
zh: 他虽然穷，但是很慷慨。

en: Money is welcome everywhere.
zh: 钱在任何地方都受欢迎。

en: There is a lot of money.
zh: 有很多钱。

en: I have some money with me.
zh: 我身上带了些钱。

en: I wouldn't like to be in his position, for all his wealth.
zh: 就算他再有钱，我也不想处在他的位置。

en: Gold is more precious than any other metal.
zh: 黄金比任何其他金属都珍贵。

en: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
zh: 不要杀掉下金蛋的鹅。

en: I feel the want of money.
zh: 我感到缺钱。

en: The price of gold varies from day to day.
zh: 黄金的价格每天都在变化。

en: The end of money is the end of love.
zh: 钱尽情绝。

en: I have no money on me.
zh: 我身上没带钱。

en: As soon as there is any talk of paying, he cools down.
zh: 一说到付钱，他就退缩了。

en: The price of gold fluctuates daily.
zh: 黄金的价格每天都在波动。

en: It is certain that the price of gold will go up.
zh: 黄金的价格肯定会上涨。

en: We had a bar of gold stolen.
zh: 我们被偷了一块金条。

en: Money doesn't grow on trees, you know.
zh: 钱不是从树上长出来的，你知道。

en: I am short of money.
zh: 我缺钱。

en: Send me the best employees that money can buy. Money is no object.
zh: 给我派来能用钱买到的最好的员工。钱不是问题。

en: I'm not pressed for money.
zh: 我不缺钱。

en: Money is the last thing he wants.
zh: 钱是他最不想要的东西。

en: Money and I are strangers; in other words, I am poor.
zh: 我和钱是陌路人；换句话说，我很穷。

en: Power and money are inseparable.
zh: 权力和金钱是分不开的。

en: Money cannot compensate for life.
zh: 金钱无法补偿生命。

en: Money soon goes.
zh: 钱很快就会花光。

en: Money cannot buy happiness.
zh: 金钱买不到幸福。

en: Money cannot buy freedom.
zh: 金钱买不到自由。

en: It goes without saying that money cannot buy happiness.
zh: 不用说，金钱买不到幸福。

en: Money can't buy happiness.
zh: 金钱买不到幸福。

en: Gold will not buy everything.
zh: 黄金并非万能。

en: In this harsh, petty world where money does the talking, his way of life is like a breath of fresh air.
zh: 在这个残酷、庸俗、金钱至上的世界里，他的生活方式就像一股清新的空气。

en: Too much money?
zh: 钱太多了吗？

en: He is rolling in riches.
zh: 他富得流油。

en: It seems like there's no money left.
zh: 好像没钱了。

en: Money talks.
zh: 有钱能使鬼推磨。

en: Little money, few friends.
zh: 人穷朋友少。

en: Money is not everything.
zh: 金钱不是万能的。

en: Some of the money was stolen.
zh: 一部分钱被偷了。

en: If I had money, I would pay what I owe you. As it is, I can't pay.
zh: 如果我有钱，我会还你欠款。但事实上，我没钱还。

en: Money enables you to buy anything.
zh: 金钱能让你买到任何东西。

en: If I were rich, I would do so. As it is, I can do nothing.
zh: 如果我很有钱，我会那样做。但事实上，我什么也做不了。

en: The neighboring countries never submitted to his terrorism.
zh: 邻国从未屈服于他的恐怖主义。

en: Prices have been gradually rising in recent years.
zh: 近年来，物价一直在逐渐上涨。

en: In recent years, they have often moved.
zh: 近年来，他们经常搬家。

en: Many local traditions have fallen into decay in recent years.
zh: 近年来，许多当地传统已经衰落。

en: In recent years, science has made remarkable progress.
zh: 近年来，科学取得了显著的进步。

en: Modern travel enables us to go around the world in a few days.
zh: 现代旅行使我们能够在几天内环游世界。

en: Recent advances in medicine are remarkable.
zh: 最近医学的进步是显著的。

en: In recent years electronic computers have become increasingly important.
zh: 近年来，电子计算机变得越来越重要。

en: Chemistry has made notable progress in recent years.
zh: 近年来，化学取得了显著的进展。

en: We will have some visitors one of these days.
zh: 总有一天我们会迎来一些访客。

en: I will be seeing her again one of these days.
zh: 总有一天我会再见到她的。

en: We are going to make up for lost time by taking a short cut.
zh: 我们要抄近路来弥补失去的时间。

en: Let's take a short cut.
zh: 我们抄近路吧。

en: Mr Kondo is the most hardworking in his company.
zh: 近藤先生是他们公司最努力工作的人。

en: Modern methods improved industry.
zh: 现代方法改进了工业。

en: The lack of modern post facilities caused trouble for many shippers.
zh: 缺乏现代邮政设施给许多托运人造成了麻烦。

en: The art of modern warfare does not necessarily require soldiers to be armed to the teeth to be effective as combatants.
zh: 现代战争的艺术并不一定要求士兵全副武装才能成为有效的战斗人员。

en: Among modern novels, this is the best.
zh: 在现代小说中，这是最好的一部。

en: Why didn't modern technology develop in China?
zh: 为什么现代科技没有在中国发展起来？

en: The advancement of modern medicine was a long process.
zh: 现代医学的进步是一个漫长的过程。

en: The whole neighborhood was surprised at the news.
zh: 整个街区都对这个消息感到惊讶。

en: His neighbors are suspicious of him.
zh: 他的邻居们怀疑他。

en: My neighbors provided food for me.
zh: 我的邻居们为我提供了食物。

en: The whole neighborhood mourned his death.
zh: 整个街区都为他的去世感到悲痛。

en: The neighbors took turns sitting up with him.
zh: 邻居们轮流守夜陪伴他。

en: You must be friendly with your neighbors.
zh: 你必须和你的邻居友好相处。

en: The neighbors made a fool of him.
zh: 邻居们捉弄了他。

en: Before saying goodbye to their neighbors, the Smiths had to tie up some loose ends inside the house.
zh: 在和邻居们告别之前，史密斯一家必须处理好房子里的一些未完成的事情。

en: Our American neighbor will have lived in Japan for five years next year.
zh: 明年我们的美国邻居将在日本居住五年。

en: There was a big fire in my neighborhood.
zh: 我的街区发生了一场大火。

en: The farmer that lived nearby came to investigate.
zh: 住在附近的农民前来调查。

en: I'm a regular at a restaurant in this neighborhood. Let's have lunch there today.
zh: 我是这个街区一家餐馆的常客。今天我们去那里吃午饭吧。

en: A fire broke out near my house.
zh: 我家附近发生了火灾。

en: Have you met the new family on the block?
zh: 你见过街区里的新家庭了吗？

en: There are a handful of naughty boys in my neighborhood.
zh: 我的街区里有几个淘气的男孩。

en: A fire broke out in the neighborhood yesterday.
zh: 昨天附近街区发生了火灾。

en: There has been another case of cholera in the neighborhood.
zh: 附近街区又出现了一例霍乱病例。

en: I haven't slept well recently.
zh: 我最近睡得不好。

en: I have seen little of him of late.
zh: 我近来很少见到他。

en: I have seen much of him lately.
zh: 我最近经常见到他。

en: The number of Japanese students returning after life abroad has been increasing as of late.
zh: 近年来，从国外生活归来的日本学生人数一直在增加。

en: Young people wear their hair long these days.
zh: 现在年轻人喜欢留长发。

en: The sudden increase of cars is causing a large number of traffic accidents every day.
zh: 最近汽车数量的突然增加导致每天发生大量的交通事故。

en: Nowadays we are apt to forget the benefits of nature.
zh: 现在我们很容易忘记大自然的好处。

en: Beef is expensive nowadays.
zh: 现在牛肉很贵。

en: These days more and more people are traveling abroad.
zh: 现在越来越多的人出国旅行。

en: Travelling is easy these days.
zh: 现在旅行很方便。

en: The recent frequency of earthquakes makes us nervous.
zh: 最近地震频繁发生，这让我们感到紧张。

en: Honesty seems to be rather at a discount today.
zh: 如今，诚实似乎不太值钱了。

en: Nowadays jobs are hard to come by.
zh: 现在工作很难找。

en: Few people visit me these days.
zh: 现在很少有人来看我。

en: Many young Japanese travel overseas these days.
zh: 现在很多日本年轻人出国旅行。

en: Business is so slow these days.
zh: 最近生意很清淡。

en: Good lumber is hard to find these days.
zh: 现在很难找到优质木材。

en: Many shoes nowadays are made of plastics.
zh: 现在很多鞋子都是用塑料制成的。

en: How are you these days?
zh: 你最近怎么样？

en: How are you getting along these days?
zh: 你最近过得怎么样？

en: That young critic is in high demand for a lot of places.
zh: 那位年轻的评论家现在很受欢迎。

en: It is not rare for girls today to talk as if they were boys.
zh: 现在女孩说话像男孩一样的情况并不少见。

en: There aren't many good tunes coming out nowadays.
zh: 现在很少有好的曲子出现。

en: As for the students of today, I don't know what they are thinking about.
zh: 现在的学生啊，我真不知道他们在想些什么。

en: What kinds of sports do you go in for these days?
zh: 你最近在从事什么运动？

en: These days you can't walk down the street without seeing people dropping litter.
zh: 现在走在街上，到处都能看到乱扔垃圾的人。

en: Boys have their own bikes these days.
zh: 现在的男孩子们都有自己的自行车。

en: These days, the motives for marriage are not necessarily pure.
zh: 现在，结婚的动机不一定纯粹。

en: I've been on edge recently.
zh: 我最近一直很焦虑。

en: Nowadays children do not play outdoors.
zh: 现在的孩子们都不在户外玩耍了。

en: I hope to see you soon.
zh: 希望很快能见到你。

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you again before long.
zh: 我期待着不久之后再次见到你。

en: The chill of coming winter discouraged our picnic.
zh: 初冬的寒意打消了我们野餐的念头。

en: She has improved her skill in cooking recently.
zh: 她最近提高了她的烹饪技巧。

en: I have not heard from her recently.
zh: 我最近没有收到她的消息。

en: Nowadays his father goes to work by car.
zh: 现在他爸爸开车去上班。

en: I have seen little of him lately.
zh: 我最近很少见到他。

en: We have had bad weather recently.
zh: 我们最近天气不好。

en: Prices are high these days.
zh: 现在物价很高。

en: Meat is very expensive nowadays.
zh: 现在肉很贵。

en: I haven't seen anything of her lately.
zh: 我最近没见过她。

en: What do you make of his attitude towards us these days?
zh: 你觉得他最近对我们的态度怎么样？

en: As these days most parents indulge their children, many children don't know what good manners are.
zh: 现在大多数父母都溺爱孩子，所以很多孩子不知道什么是礼貌。

en: What kind of songs are popular these days?
zh: 现在流行什么歌曲？

en: These days, the motive for marriage is not necessarily pure.
zh: 现在，结婚的动机不一定纯粹。

en: These days, the motive for marriage is not necessarily pure. Take Jennifer for example.
zh: 现在，结婚的动机不一定纯粹。就拿珍妮弗来说吧。

en: Recently juvenile delinquency has been on the rise.
zh: 最近青少年犯罪率一直在上升。

en: Please drop in when you happen to be in the neighborhood.
zh: 如果你碰巧在附近，请顺便来访。

en: Close things look blurred.
zh: 近处的东西看起来很模糊。

en: How about playing catch in the vacant lot near by?
zh: 要不要在附近的空地上玩捉迷藏？

en: We could hear the donnnng ... donnnng of the church bells nearby.
zh: 我们可以听到附近教堂的咚…咚…钟声。

en: There is a hospital nearby.
zh: 附近有一家医院。

en: There is a shopping area nearby.
zh: 附近有一个购物区。

en: Sit near at hand.
zh: 坐在手边。

en: There is a flower shop near by.
zh: 附近有一家花店。

en: Are there any movie theaters near here?
zh: 这附近有电影院吗？

en: Is there a McDonald's near here?
zh: 这附近有麦当劳吗？

en: There is a bus stop near by.
zh: 附近有一个公交车站。

en: Are there any towns with festivals near here?
zh: 这附近有什么有节日的城镇吗？

en: There's a nice Thai restaurant near here.
zh: 这附近有一家不错的泰国餐厅。

en: A fire broke out nearby.
zh: 附近发生了火灾。

en: Baskets are being made nearby.
zh: 附近有人在编篮子。

en: I'm looking forward to hearing from you soon.
zh: 期待尽快收到你的来信。

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you before long.
zh: 期待不久后见到你。

en: I would like to repay your kindness in the near future.
zh: 我想在不久的将来报答你的恩情。

en: Do you think you'll be getting more in soon?
zh: 你觉得你们很快会进更多货吗？

en: In the near future, we may have a big earthquake in Japan.
zh: 在不久的将来，日本可能会发生大地震。

en: We may meet again in the near future.
zh: 我们可能会在不久的将来再次见面。

en: There is no telling what will happen in the near future.
zh: 谁也说不准在不久的将来会发生什么。

en: In the near future, space travel will no longer be just a dream.
zh: 在不久的将来，太空旅行将不再只是一个梦想。

en: There will be an energy crisis in the near future.
zh: 在不久的将来，将会出现能源危机。

en: Will there be an earthquake in the near future?
zh: 在不久的将来会发生地震吗？

en: Can we get to the moon in the near future?
zh: 在不久的将来我们能登上月球吗？

en: In the near future, we will be able to put an end to AIDS.
zh: 在不久的将来，我们将能够终结艾滋病。

en: These problems will be solved in the near future.
zh: 这些问题在不久的将来会得到解决。

en: Before long, we'll be able to communicate with each other by T.V. telephone.
zh: 不久之后，我们将能够通过电视电话互相交流。

en: We will soon most likely be charged for garbage disposal by how much of it there is.
zh: 我们很可能很快就会根据垃圾的数量来收取垃圾处理费。

en: They dance in circles to communicate a short distance, and shake their bodies and dart back and forth to indicate a longer distance.
zh: 它们跳圈舞来传递短距离的信息，摇动身体并来回冲刺来表示更远的距离。

en: I'll get in touch with you soon.
zh: 我会尽快和你联系。

en: I'll drop in on you sometime in the near future.
zh: 我会在不久的将来拜访你。

en: I hope it won't be long before I hear from her.
zh: 我希望不久就能收到她的来信。

en: One of these fine days he will get his just deserts.
zh: 总有一天他会得到应有的报应。

en: I hope to see his picture soon.
zh: 我希望很快能看到他的照片。

en: They say we'll have an earthquake one of these days.
zh: 他们说总有一天我们会发生地震。

en: It is said that there will be a big earthquake in the near future.
zh: 据说在不久的将来会发生大地震。

en: It is said that there will be an election soon.
zh: 据说很快就要举行选举了。

en: Spring will be here before long.
zh: 春天很快就会到来。

en: Why don't you come to my house one of these days?
zh: 哪天你来我家坐坐怎么样？

en: This city will suffer from an acute water shortage unless it rains soon.
zh: 如果再不下雨，这个城市将遭受严重的缺水。

en: I look forward to meeting you again soon.
zh: 我期待着很快再次见到你。

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you again soon.
zh: 我期待着很快再次见到你。

en: We'll meet some time soon.
zh: 我们很快会找个时间见面。

en: I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
zh: 我期待着很快收到你的来信。

en: You'll be hearing from us soon.
zh: 你很快就会收到我们的消息。

en: I'll be able to see you one of these days.
zh: 总有一天我能见到你。

en: I'll come and see you one of these days.
zh: 总有一天我会来看你。

en: I would like to call on you one of these days.
zh: 我想找个时间拜访你。

en: We'll visit you one of these days.
zh: 总有一天我们会去看你。

en: I'm thinking of visiting you one of these days.
zh: 我打算过几天去看你。

en: May I come to see you one of these days?
zh: 我能过几天去看你吗？

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you one of these days.
zh: 我期待着过几天见到你。

en: Tension is a major cause of heart disease.
zh: 精神紧张是导致心脏病的主要原因。

en: The fiscal austerity may lead to an overkill of the economy.
zh: 财政紧缩可能会导致经济矫枉过正。

en: What is the emergency telephone number?
zh: 紧急电话号码是多少？

en: Report to the emergency room.
zh: 去急诊室报到。

en: We have reserved a lot of food for emergencies.
zh: 我们为紧急情况储备了很多食物。

en: An emergency may occur at any time.
zh: 紧急情况可能随时发生。

en: I canceled my appointment because of urgent business.
zh: 因为有急事，我取消了预约。

en: I need to make an urgent call. Is there a public phone near here?
zh: 我需要打个紧急电话。这附近有公用电话吗？

en: Don't look to me for any help except in case of emergency.
zh: 除非紧急情况，否则别指望我提供任何帮助。

en: In case of an emergency, call the police.
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，请报警。

en: This rule doesn't apply to emergencies.
zh: 这条规则不适用于紧急情况。

en: What number should I call in case of an emergency?
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，我应该拨打什么号码？

en: In case of an emergency, push this button.
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，请按此按钮。

en: In case of emergency, call 119.
zh: 紧急情况下，请拨打119。

en: In case of an emergency, dial 110.
zh: 紧急情况下，请拨打110。

en: In case of an emergency, get in touch with my agent.
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，请与我的经纪人联系。

en: In case of emergency, call the police.
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，请报警。

en: In case of an emergency, get in touch with my agent right away.
zh: 如果发生紧急情况，请立即与我的经纪人联系。

en: Muscle tissue consists of innumerable cells.
zh: 肌肉组织由无数细胞组成。

en: My muscles have got soft.
zh: 我的肌肉变得松弛了。

en: Apart from the plot, the book interested me.
zh: 除了情节之外，这本书引起了我的兴趣。

en: During prohibition days, racketeers used to rub each other out to get control of the rum-running racket.
zh: 在禁酒时期，敲诈勒索者常常互相残杀，以控制走私朗姆酒的非法活动。

en: I asked for a seat in the no-smoking section.
zh: 我要求坐在无烟区。

en: I asked for a seat in the non-smoking section.
zh: 我要求坐在无烟区。

en: I would like to sit in the non-smoking section.
zh: 我想坐在无烟区。

en: Do you have a non-smoking section?
zh: 你们有无烟区吗？

en: Could we have a table in the non-smoking section?
zh: 我们可以在无烟区要一张桌子吗？

en: Smoking or non smoking?
zh: 吸烟区还是无烟区？

en: I advise you to stop smoking.
zh: 我建议你戒烟。

en: It is difficult to give up smoking.
zh: 戒烟很难。

en: There are marked and rapidly, steadily increasing health benefits to giving up.
zh: 戒烟对健康有显著且快速、稳定增长的益处。

en: I'll give up smoking.
zh: 我要戒烟。

en: What method did you use to give up smoking?
zh: 你用什么方法戒烟的？

en: Please refrain from smoking, while the non-smoking signs are on.
zh: 请勿吸烟，当无烟标志亮着的时候。

en: Thank you for not smoking.
zh: 谢谢您不吸烟。

en: Hard work has made Japan what it is today.
zh: 努力工作造就了今天的日本。

en: You must work very hard on duty.
zh: 你必须在工作时非常努力。

en: The police officer on duty sensed an elderly man coming up behind him.
zh: 值班的警察感觉到一位老人走到他身后。

en: Smoking on duty is not allowed.
zh: 上班时间不允许吸烟。

en: Don't smoke while you are on duty.
zh: 上班时不要吸烟。

en: The workers complained when their working hours were extended.
zh: 工人们抱怨工作时间延长。

en: Diligence is the way to success.
zh: 勤奋是成功的途径。

en: Diligence is the mother of good fortune.
zh: 勤奋是好运之母。

en: Hard work is the price of success.
zh: 努力工作是成功的代价。

en: Hard work is the main element of success.
zh: 努力工作是成功的主要因素。

en: Diligence is essential to success in life.
zh: 勤奋是人生成功的关键。

en: Diligence led him to success.
zh: 勤奋使他走向成功。

en: His diligence earned him success.
zh: 他的勤奋为他赢得了成功。

en: Industrious people look down on laziness.
zh: 勤奋的人鄙视懒惰。

en: A diligent man will succeed in the long run.
zh: 勤奋的人终将成功。

en: In the end, the diligent person succeeds.
zh: 最终，勤奋的人会成功。

en: Some boys are diligent, others are idle.
zh: 有些男孩很勤奋，有些则很懒惰。

en: His diligence and good conduct earned him the scholarship.
zh: 他的勤奋和良好品行为他赢得了奖学金。

en: She became rich by virtue of hard work and good business sense.
zh: 她凭借努力工作和良好的商业头脑而致富。

en: Hard work has brought him where he is.
zh: 努力工作使他达到了今天的成就。

en: Diligence may compensate for lack of experience.
zh: 勤奋可以弥补经验的不足。

en: Hard work enabled him to succeed.
zh: 努力工作使他能够成功。

en: It goes without saying that diligence is a key to success.
zh: 不用说，勤奋是成功的关键。

en: Needless to say, diligence is a key to happiness.
zh: 不用说，勤奋是幸福的关键。

en: Slight inattention can cause a great disaster.
zh: 稍有疏忽可能会酿成大祸。

en: I gave him what little money I had.
zh: 我把他仅有的一点钱都给了他。

en: Tears came into my eyes when I was chopping onions.
zh: 我切洋葱的时候，眼泪都出来了。

en: Don't go to extremes.
zh: 不要走极端。

en: Don't go to extremes. To be moderate is important in anything.
zh: 不要走极端。凡事适度很重要。

en: He does not, in short, write with the candor of a man who is completely confident of his thesis.
zh: 简而言之，他写作时并不像一个完全相信自己论点的人那样坦率。

en: Even the smallest worm will turn if trodden on.
zh: 即使是最小的虫子，被踩到也会反抗。

en: The habits of highly intelligent people offer a clue as to how to do that.
zh: 高智商人士的习惯为我们如何做到这一点提供了线索。

en: It's a long road with no curves.
zh: 这是一条没有弯路的漫长道路。

en: Though imperfectly, he finished writing his manuscript.
zh: 虽然不完美，但他还是完成了手稿的写作。

en: I'll give you a local anaesthetic.
zh: 我会给你局部麻醉。

en: I have an itch in my pubic area.
zh: 我的耻骨区域发痒。

en: The director wanted the local Asahi reporter to go to the scene of the crime.
zh: 导演希望当地的朝日新闻记者去犯罪现场。

en: I'm glad we didn't go there because there were some localized heavy rain showers.
zh: 我很高兴我们没去那里，因为那里有一些局部地区的强降雨。

en: We decided to branch out into selling some foodstuffs.
zh: 我们决定扩展业务，开始销售一些食品。

en: An accomplishment cannot be looked upon as yours unless you paddled your own canoe.
zh: 除非是你自己努力奋斗得来的，否则一项成就不能被认为是你的。

en: A delivery man is dropping off an arrangement of artificial flowers.
zh: 一个送货员正在送来一束人造花。

en: Fair competition is necessary for the healthy growth of industry.
zh: 公平竞争是工业健康发展的必要条件。

en: Turn on your back.
zh: 翻过身去，仰面朝上。

en: You startled me!
zh: 你吓我一跳！

en: Amazingly, the old man recovered his health.
zh: 令人惊奇的是，这位老人恢复了健康。

en: To my astonishment, my money was gone.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，我的钱不见了。

en: Between astonishment and sorrow, she could not speak a word.
zh: 她又惊又悲，说不出一句话。

en: I was too astonished to speak.
zh: 我太惊讶了，说不出话来。

en: Astonishment deprived me of speech.
zh: 惊讶得我说不出话来。

en: I was too surprised to speak.
zh: 我太惊讶了，说不出话来。

en: The vase on my desk overturned when I jumped up in surprise.
zh: 我惊讶地跳起来时，我桌子上的花瓶被打翻了。

en: Her eyes become round in surprise.
zh: 她的眼睛因惊讶而睁大了。

en: I stared back at her in surprise.
zh: 我惊讶地回望着她。

en: I start in surprise.
zh: 我吓了一跳。

en: To my surprise, she was alive.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，她还活着。

en: To my surprise, she could not answer the question.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，她无法回答这个问题。

en: To my surprise, there were no people in the village.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，村子里没有人。

en: To my surprise, the child came here by himself all the way from Yokohama.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，这个孩子竟然独自一人从横滨一路来到这里。

en: It's astonishing, the size of his head.
zh: 真令人吃惊，他的头真大。

en: What a surprise!
zh: 真令人惊讶！

en: I found, to my surprise, that she was dead.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，我发现她已经死了。

en: To his surprise, she was nowhere in sight, and he wondered if she had returned home alone.
zh: 令他惊讶的是，她不见踪影，他想知道她是否独自回家了。

en: To our surprise, he scoffed the lot.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，他狼吞虎咽地吃光了。

en: To my surprise, he won the prize.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他赢得了奖品。

en: To our surprise, he was defeated in the match.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，他在比赛中被打败了。

en: To my surprise, they ate the meat raw.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他们生吃了肉。

en: To our surprise, our son has suddenly shot up recently.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，我们的儿子最近突然长高了很多。

en: To my great surprise, we won!
zh: 让我非常吃惊的是，我们赢了！

en: To my surprise, he has failed.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他失败了。

en: To my surprise, the door was unlocked.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，门没锁。

en: To my amazement, it disappeared in an instant.
zh: 让我惊讶的是，它瞬间消失了。

en: To our surprise, she has gone to Brazil alone.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，她独自去了巴西。

en: To my surprise, she spoke English very well.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，她说英语说得非常好。

en: To our surprise, she revived at once.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，她立刻复活了。

en: To my surprise, he got married to a very beautiful actress.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他和一位非常漂亮的女演员结婚了。

en: To my surprise, he failed the examination.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他考试不及格。

en: To my surprise, he refused my offer.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他拒绝了我的提议。

en: To my surprise, he easily came up with a plan.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他轻易地想出了一个计划。

en: To my surprise, he had a beautiful voice.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，他有一副美妙的嗓音。

en: Surprisingly enough, he turned out to be a thief.
zh: 令人惊讶的是，他竟然是个小偷。

en: To my dismay, my wallet was gone.
zh: 让我沮丧的是，我的钱包不见了。

en: Surprisingly, he did his last job in one-third the time it would take me.
zh: 令人惊讶的是，他用我三分之一的时间完成了他的最后一份工作。

en: To our surprise, Tom came to our party with Mary.
zh: 让我们吃惊的是，汤姆和玛丽一起来参加我们的聚会。

en: To my surprise, the noted psychologist was accused of a kidnapping.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，那位著名的心理学家被指控绑架。

en: To my surprise, the anthropologist was accused of murder.
zh: 让我吃惊的是，那位人类学家被指控谋杀。

en: Hasn't he looked at himself in a mirror?
zh: 他难道没照过镜子吗？

en: Don't break a mirror.
zh: 不要打碎镜子。

en: A mirror reflects light.
zh: 镜子反射光。

en: Fragments of the mirror were scattered on the floor.
zh: 镜子的碎片散落在地板上。

en: In nostalgic moments we may tend to think of childhood as a time of almost unbroken happiness.
zh: 在怀旧的时刻，我们可能会倾向于认为童年是几乎没有间断的幸福时光。

en: To be an interesting person you have to feed and exercise your mind.
zh: 要想成为一个有趣的人，你必须滋养和锻炼你的头脑。

en: Thank you for your interest.
zh: 感谢您的关注。

en: The phenomenon of interest is in itself, a most interesting subject.
zh: 兴趣这种现象本身就是一个非常有趣的话题。

en: He is not just interested, he's crazy about it.
zh: 他不仅仅是感兴趣，他对它简直是着迷。

en: The excitement reached its peak.
zh: 兴奋达到了顶峰。

en: Her heart was throbbing with excitement.
zh: 她的心激动地跳动着。

en: Getting excited is not at all the same as getting angry.
zh: 兴奋和生气完全不一样。

en: As he grew excited, he spoke more and more rapidly.
zh: 他越兴奋，说话就越快。

en: Excited girls look pretty sometimes.
zh: 兴奋的女孩有时候看起来很漂亮。

en: I was so excited that I could not fall asleep.
zh: 我太兴奋了，以至于睡不着。

en: The excited woman tried to explain the accident all in one breath.
zh: 激动的女人试图一口气解释清楚事故。

en: The excited crowd poured out of the stadium.
zh: 兴奋的人群涌出体育场。

en: The excited audience ran into the concert hall.
zh: 兴奋的观众跑进了音乐厅。

en: When the excitement died down, the discussion resumed.
zh: 当兴奋平息下来时，讨论又重新开始了。

en: A wet blanket is not always unpleasant when you come to know him well.
zh: 当你真正了解他之后，扫兴的人并不总是令人讨厌。

en: A promise given under a threat is worthless.
zh: 在威胁下做出的承诺毫无价值。

en: Don't scare me like that!
zh: 别那样吓我！

en: I'd like you to have a chest X-ray.
zh: 我想让你做个胸部X光检查。

en: With her heart pounding, she opened the door.
zh: 她心跳加速，打开了门。

en: I waited for the curtain to rise with my heart beating in excitement.
zh: 我心怀激动地等待着幕布拉开。

en: Would you like me to massage your chest?
zh: 你想让我给你按摩胸部吗？

en: I have heartburn.
zh: 我烧心。

en: It was a heartbreaking story.
zh: 这是一个令人心碎的故事。

en: I feel like vomiting.
zh: 我想吐。

en: I have a sharp pain in my chest.
zh: 我胸口一阵剧痛。

en: I have butterflies in my stomach.
zh: 我感到很紧张。

en: I could not speak a word, for my heart was full.
zh: 我一句话也说不出来，因为我心里充满了感情。

en: I had an angina attack.
zh: 我得了心绞痛。

en: Enter by the narrow gate.
zh: 进窄门。

en: I made the best of my small room.
zh: 我充分利用了我狭小的房间。

en: A small road ran across the bridge, through the fields, and over a hill.
zh: 一条小路穿过桥，穿过田野，越过一座小山。

en: Two fat men trying to pass through a narrow doorway are in checkmate.
zh: 两个胖子试图穿过一个狭窄的门口，结果进退两难。

en: I am confused by your frenzied behaviour.
zh: 我对你疯狂的行为感到困惑。

en: Look out for the wild dog!
zh: 小心野狗！

en: It is no use trying to separate the sheep from the goats while in a state of madness.
zh: 在疯狂的状态下试图区分绵羊和山羊是没有用的。

en: Are you mad?
zh: 你疯了吗？

en: Mr. Hashimoto is fair to us.
zh: 桥本先生对我们很公平。

en: Mr Hashimoto was confused by Ken's question.
zh: 桥本先生被健的问题搞糊涂了。

en: Tom started the engine.
zh: 汤姆启动了引擎。

en: Mr Hashimoto is known to everyone.
zh: 桥本先生是众所周知的。

en: As he crossed the bridge, he looked down at the stream.
zh: 当他过桥时，他向下看着小溪。

en: I'll go with you as far as the bridge.
zh: 我陪你到桥边。

en: Bridges are burning and chances are few.
zh: 桥梁正在燃烧，机会不多了。

en: The bridge is being repainted.
zh: 桥正在重新粉刷。

en: The bridge was carried away by the flood.
zh: 桥被洪水冲走了。

en: The bridge was washed away by the flood.
zh: 桥被洪水冲走了。

en: The bridge is made of stone.
zh: 这座桥是石头做的。
